Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the shoulder section of buff-coloured pottery convex vessel, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a red-brown coloured slip and bears the remains of ten lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a table of fractions.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.54-55)
Hasitzka 1990 / Neue Texte und Dokumentation zum Koptisch-Unterricht (p.266-67)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (89510) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/89510)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Rain.UnterrichtKopt. 323 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 24 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
